info.title: PhoneNumbersClient
info.description: The phone numbers client uses Azure Communication Services to purchase and manage phone numbers.

patch.summary: Create or update a US 10DLC brand.

delete.summary: Deletes a US 10DLC Brand. Must be a draft or cancelled brand to be deleted.

get.summary: Gets the details of a US 10DLC Brand.

post.summary: Submits a US 10DLC Brand that has draft status.

get.summary: Gets the list of US 10DLC Brands, with pagination.

post.summary: Cancels a US 10DLC brand that has been submitted.
Submits a denied US 10DLC brand for external vetting.

patch.summary: Creates or updates a US 10DLC Campaign.

get.summary: Gets the details of a US 10DLC Campaign.
Gets a list of US 10DLC Campaigns, with pagination.

put.summary: Creates or replace an attachment on a US 10DLC Campaign.

parameters.name: campaignId
parameters.description: 10DLC US Campaign Id. Must be a valid GUID

parameters.name: attachmentId
parameters.description: Attachment Id. Must be a valid GUID

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Data to create or replace a 10DLC US Campaign File Attachment

get.summary: Gets a specific an attachment from a US 10DLC Campaign.

parameters.name: campaignId
parameters.description: 10DLC US Campaign Id. Must be a valid GUID

parameters.name: attachmentId
parameters.description: Attachment Id. Must be a valid GUID

delete.summary: Deletes a specific attachment from a US 10DLC Campaign.

parameters.name: campaignId
parameters.description: 10DLC US Campaign Id. Must be a valid GUID

parameters.name: attachmentId
parameters.description: Attachment Id. Must be a valid GUID

get.summary: Gets the list of attachments from a US 10DLC Campaign.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: An optional parameter for how many entries to skip, for pagination purposes.

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: An optional parameter for how many entries to return, for pagination purposes.

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of eligible 10DLC costs with pagination.
get.description: This method supports pagination via the "skip" and "top" query parameters.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The number of items to skip in the result set (default: 0).

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return in the result set (default: 100).

200.description: Returns the paginated collection of eligible 10DLC costs.

tags: Browse for available countries, cities and area codes
get.summary: Gets the list of available area codes.

parameters.name: countryCode
parameters.description: The ISO 3166-2 country code, e.g. US.

parameters.name: phoneNumberType
parameters.description: Filter by numberType, e.g. Geographic, TollFree, Mobile.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: An optional parameter for how many entries to skip, for pagination purposes. The default value is 0.

parameters.name: maxPageSize
parameters.description: An optional parameter for how many entries to return, for pagination purposes. The default value is 100.

parameters.name: assignmentType
parameters.description: Filter by assignmentType, e.g. Person, Application.

parameters.name: locality
parameters.description: The name of locality or town in which to search for the area code. This is required if the number type is Geographic.

parameters.name: administrativeDivision
parameters.description: The name of the state or province in which to search for the area code.

parameters.name: accept-language
parameters.description: The locale to display in the localized fields in the response. e.g. 'en-US'

tags: Browse for available countries, cities and area codes
get.summary: Gets the list of supported countries.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: An optional parameter for how many entries to skip, for pagination purposes. The default value is 0.

parameters.name: maxPageSize
parameters.description: An optional parameter for how many entries to return, for pagination purposes. The default value is 100.

parameters.name: accept-language
parameters.description: The locale to display in the localized fields in the response. e.g. 'en-US'

tags: Browse, reserve and purchase available phone numbers
post.summary: Browses for available phone numbers to purchase.
post.description: Browses for available phone numbers to purchase. The response will be a randomized list of phone numbers available to purchase matching the browsing criteria. This operation is not paginated. Since the results are randomized, repeating the same request will not guarantee the same results.

parameters.name: phoneNumbersBrowseRequest
parameters.description: An object defining the criteria to browse for available phone numbers.

200.description: A randomized list of phone numbers available to purchase matching the browsing criteria.

parameters.description: An optional parameter for the name of the state or province in which to search for the area code.

parameters.description: The locale to display in the localized fields in the response. e.g. 'en-US'

parameters.name: phoneNumberType
parameters.description: Filter by numberType, e.g. Geographic, TollFree, Mobile.

tags: Browse, reserve and purchase available phone numbers
get.description: Retrieves a paginated list of all phone number reservations. Note that the reservations will not be populated with the phone numbers associated with them.

200.description: A collection of Phone Number Reservations, and an optional link to the next page of results.

tags: Browse, reserve and purchase available phone numbers
patch.summary: Creates or updates a reservation by its ID.
patch.description: Adds and removes phone numbers from the reservation with the given ID. The response will be the updated state of the reservation. Phone numbers can be reserved by including them in the payload. If a number is already in the reservation, it will be ignored. To remove a phone number, set it explicitly to null in the request payload. This operation is idempotent. If a reservation with the same ID already exists, it will be updated, otherwise a new one is created. Only reservations with 'active' status can be updated. Updating a reservation will extend the expiration time of the reservation to 15 minutes after the last change, up to a maximum of 2 hours from creation time. Partial success is possible, in which case the response will have a 207 status code.

207.description: Reservation operation partially succeeded. This can happen when the operation (create or update) is processed successfully, but it failed for at least one of the phone numbers in the request.

tags: Browse, reserve and purchase available phone numbers
get.summary: Gets a reservation by its ID.
get.description: Retrieves the reservation with the given ID, including all of the phone numbers associated with it.

tags: Browse, reserve and purchase available phone numbers
delete.summary: Deletes a reservation by its ID.
delete.description: Deletes the reservation with the given ID. Any phone number in the reservation will be released and made available for others to purchase. Only reservations with 'active' status can be deleted.

tags: Browse, reserve and purchase available phone numbers
post.summary: Starts the purchase of all phone numbers in the reservation.
post.description: Starts a long running operation to purchase all of the phone numbers in the reservation. Purchase can only be started for active reservations that at least one phone number. If any of the phone numbers in the reservation is from a country where reselling is not permitted, do not resell agreement is required. The response will include an 'Operation-Location' header that can be used to query the status of the operation.

202.description: The service has accepted the request and will start processing later. It will return 'Accepted' immediately and include an 'Operation-Location' header. Client side should further query the operation status using the URL specified in 'Operation-Location' header.

Operation-Location.description: URL to query for status of the operation.

tags: Find and purchase available phone numbers
post.summary: Search for available phone numbers to purchase.

parameters.name: countryCode
parameters.description: The ISO 3166-2 country code, e.g. US.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The phone number search request.

202.description: The service has accepted the request and will start processing later. It will return 'Accepted' immediately and include an 'Operation-Location' and 'Location' headers. Client side should further query the operation status using the URL specified in 'Operation-Location' header. When operation completes successfully query final result using URL specified in 'Location' header.

Location.description: URL to retrieve the final result after operation completes.

Operation-Location.description: URL to query for status of the operation.

tags: Find and purchase available phone numbers
get.summary: Gets a phone number search result by search id.

parameters.name: searchId
parameters.description: The search Id.

tags: Find and purchase available phone numbers

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The phone number purchase request

202.description: The service has accepted the request and will start processing later. It will return 'Accepted' immediately and include an 'Operation-Location' header. Client side should further query the operation status using the URL specified in 'Operation-Location' header.

Operation-Location.description: URL to query for status of the operation.

get.summary: Gets an operation by its id.

parameters.name: operationId
parameters.description: The id of the operation

200.description: When the operation is completed, query the final result of the operation using the URL specified in the 'Location' attribute in the response header.

Location.description: Url to retrieve the final result after operation completes.

delete.summary: Cancels an operation by its id.

parameters.name: operationId
parameters.description: The id of the operation

patch.summary: Updates the capabilities of a phone number.

parameters.name: phoneNumber
parameters.description: The phone number id in E.164 format. The leading plus can be either + or encoded as %2B, e.g. +11234567890.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Defines the update capabilities request.

202.description: The service has accepted the request and will start processing later. It will return 'Accepted' immediately and include an 'Operation-Location' and 'Location' headers. Client side should further query the operation status using the URL specified in 'Operation-Location' header. When operation completes successfully query final result using URL specified in 'Location' header.

Location.description: URL to retrieve the final result after operation completes.

Operation-Location.description: URL to query for status of the operation.

get.summary: Gets the details of the given purchased phone number.

parameters.name: phoneNumber
parameters.description: The purchased phone number whose details are to be fetched in E.164 format, e.g. +11234567890.

parameters.name: phoneNumber
parameters.description: Phone number to be released, e.g. +11234567890.

202.description: The service has accepted the request and will start processing later. It will return 'Accepted' immediately and include an 'Operation-Location' header. Client side should further query the operation status using the URL specified in 'Operation-Location' header.

Operation-Location.description: URL to query for status of the operation.

parameters.description: An optional parameter for how many entries to skip, for pagination purposes. The default value is 0.

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: An optional parameter for how many entries to return, for pagination purposes. The default value is 100.

tags: Obtain operator information for requested numbers
post.summary: Searches for number format and operator information for a given list of phone numbers.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The phone number(s) whose number format and operator information should be searched

OfferingsResponse.description: Represents a wrapper around a list of offerings.

phoneNumberOfferings.description: Represents the underlying list of offerings.

nextLink.description: Represents the URL link to the next page.

OperatorDetails.description: Represents metadata describing the operator of a phone number

mobileNetworkCode.description: Mobile Network Code, 2 or 3 decimal digits that identify mobile networks within a country/region

mobileCountryCode.description: Mobile Country Code, 3 decimal digits that identify a country/region

OperatorInformation.description: Represents metadata about a phone number that is controlled/provided by that phone number's operator.

phoneNumber.description: E.164 formatted string representation of the phone number

nationalFormat.description: National format of the phone number

internationalFormat.description: International format of the phone number

isoCountryCode.description: ISO 3166-1 two character ('alpha-2') code associated with the phone number.

numberType.description: Type of service associated with the phone number

OperatorInformationOptions.description: Represents options to modify a search request for operator information

includeAdditionalOperatorDetails.description: Includes the fields operatorDetails, numberType, and isoCountryCode in the response.  Please note: use of this option will result in additional costs

OperatorInformationRequest.description: Represents a search request for operator information for the given phone numbers.

phoneNumbers.description: Phone number(s) whose operator information is being requested

OperatorInformationResult.description: Represents a search result containing format and operator information associated with the requested phone numbers

values.description: Results of a search. This array will have one entry per requested phone number which will contain the relevant operator information.

PhoneNumberAdministrativeDivision.description: Represents an administrative division. e.g. state or province.

localizedName.description: Represents the localized name of the administrative division of the locality. e.g. state or province localized name.

abbreviatedName.description: Represents the abbreviated name of the administrative division of the locality. e.g. state or province abbreviation such as WA (Washington).

PhoneNumberAreaCodes.description: The list of available area codes.

areaCodes.description: Represents a list of available toll-free area codes.

nextLink.description: Represents the URL link to the next page.

tenDlcCampaignId.description: Approved 10DLC Campaign Id to attach to a number
Approved 10DLC Campaign Id to attach to a number. This is required for adding SMS to Geographic numbers

PhoneNumberCost.description: The incurred cost for a single phone number.

currencyCode.description: The ISO 4217 currency code for the cost amount, e.g. USD.

billingFrequency.description: The frequency with which the cost gets billed.

PhoneNumberCountries.description: Represents a wrapper around a list of countries.

countries.description: Represents the underlying list of countries.

nextLink.description: Represents the URL link to the next page

localizedName.description: Represents the name of the country.

countryCode.description: Represents the abbreviated name of the country.

PhoneNumberLocalities.description: Represents a wrapper around a list of cities or towns.

phoneNumberLocalities.description: Represents the underlying list of localities, e.g. cities or town.

nextLink.description: Represents the URL link to the next page.

localizedName.description: Represents the localized name of the locality.

PhoneNumberOffering.description: Represents a phone number capability offering

phoneNumberType.description: Represents the number type of the offering.

assignmentType.description: Represents the assignment type of the offering.

operationType.description: The type of operation, e.g. Search

resourceLocation.description: URL for retrieving the result of the operation, if any.

createdDateTime.description: The date that the operation was created.

lastActionDateTime.description: The most recent date that the operation was changed.

PhoneNumberPurchaseRequest.description: The phone number search purchase request.

agreeToNotResell.description: The agreement to not resell the phone numbers. Defaults to false if not provided.

PhoneNumberSearchRequest.description: Represents a phone number search request to find phone numbers. Found phone numbers are temporarily held for a following purchase.

phoneNumberType.description: The type of phone numbers to search for, e.g. geographic, tollFree, mobile.

assignmentType.description: The assignment type of the phone numbers to search for. A phone number can be assigned to a person, or to an application.

areaCode.description: The area code of the desired phone number, e.g. 425.

quantity.description: The quantity of desired phone numbers. The default value is 1.

PhoneNumberSearchResult.description: The result of a phone number search operation.

phoneNumbers.description: The phone numbers that are available. Can be fewer than the desired search quantity.

phoneNumberType.description: The phone number's type, e.g. geographic, tollFree, mobile.

searchExpiresBy.description: The date that this search result expires and phone numbers are no longer on hold. A search result expires in less than 15min, e.g. 2020-11-19T16:31:49.048Z.

isAgreementToNotResellRequired.description: Indicates if do not resell agreement is required. If true, the phone numbers cannot be acquired unless the customer provides explicit agreement to not resell them.

errorCode.description: The error code of the search.

id.description: The id of the phone number, e.g. 11234567890.

phoneNumber.description: String of the E.164 format of the phone number, e.g. +11234567890.

countryCode.description: The ISO 3166-2 code of the phone number's country, e.g. US.

phoneNumberType.description: The phone number's type, e.g. geographic, tollFree, mobile.

assignmentType.description: The assignment type of the phone number. A phone number can be assigned to a person, or to an application.

purchaseDate.description: The date and time that the phone number was purchased.

PurchasedPhoneNumbers.description: The list of purchased phone numbers.

phoneNumbers.description: Represents a list of phone numbers.

nextLink.description: Represents the URL link to the next page of phone number results.

PhoneNumbersBrowseRequest.description: The parameters for the browse operation.

phoneNumberType.description: Represents the number type of the offering.

assignmentType.description: Represents the assignment type of the offering. Also known as the use case.

phoneNumberPrefixes.description: The phone number prefix to match. If specified, the search will be limited to phone numbers that start with the any of the given prefixes.

PhoneNumberBrowseCapabilitiesRequest.description: The minimum desired capabilities for the browse operation request.

PhoneNumbersBrowseResult.description: The result of a phone number browse operation.

phoneNumbers.description: The phone numbers that are available for purchase.

AvailablePhoneNumber.description: Represents a phone number available in inventory

id.description: The id of the phone number.

countryCode.description: The ISO 3166-2 country code, e.g. US.

phoneNumber.description: The phone number in E.164 format, e.g. +11234567890.

phoneNumberType.description: Represents the number type of the offering.

assignmentType.description: Represents the assignment type of the offering. Also known as the use case.

cost.description: The incurred cost for this phone number.

status.description: Represents the status of the phone number. Possible values include: 'available', 'reserved', 'expired', 'error', 'purchased'.

isAgreementToNotResellRequired.description: Indicates if do not resell agreement is required. If true, the phone number cannot be acquired unless the customer provides explicit agreement to not resell it.

AvailablePhoneNumberError.description: Contains error details in case of failure when reserving, releasing or purchasing the phone number. Note that this is ignored by the service when present in requests.

code.description: The error code indicating the reason why the operation performed on the phone number failed.

message.description: The error message describing the failure that occurred.

PhoneNumbersReservations.description: Represents a list of phone numbers reservations. Note that the phone numbers from each reservation are not included.

reservations.description: Represents a list of phone numbers reservations. Note that the phone numbers from each reservation are not included.

nextLink.description: Represents the URL link to the next page of phone number results.

PhoneNumbersReservation.description: Represents a reservation for phone numbers. A reservation is a temporary hold on phone numbers that can later be purchased. The reservation has a limited lifetime after which the phone numbers are released if not purchased. Reservations older than 1 month are automatically deleted.

expiresAt.description: The time at which the reservation will expire. If a reservation is not purchased before this time, all of the reserved phone numbers will be released and made available for others to purchase.

phoneNumbers.description: A dictionary containing the reservation phone numbers. The key is the ID of the phone number (digits only) and values are AvailablePhoneNumber objects. Not populated when retrieving PhoneNumbersReservation collections.

status.description: Represents the status of the reservation. Possible values include: 'active', 'submitted', 'completed', 'expired'.

PhoneNumbersReservationPurchaseRequest.description: The phone number search purchase request.

agreeToNotResell.description: The agreement to not resell the phone numbers. Defaults to false if not provided.

city.description: The city for the addresses, for example Los Angeles.

state.description: The state for the addresses, for example California.

entityType.description: Legal structure or form a company takes

stockExchange.description: Marketplace where stocks, bonds, etc... are bought and sold

taxNumber.description: Business Id that corresponds to your business

callToAction.description: Call to action text. To be provided when InteractiveVoiceResponse is specified as call to action type

description.description: Describes how and why the number will be used for messaging as part of the program.

termsAndConditionsUrl.description: URL to the terms and conditions

TenDlcContactInformation.description: Represent contact information for the brand.

phone.description: Contact phone number for the authorized user for the customer. Use E164 format. e.g. +14086111111

email.description: Contact email address number for the authorized user for the customer

TenDlcMessageDetails.description: Compiles details describing how the messaging campaign will work, for example whether opt-in and opt-out will be required and how will the messages for those actions look like.

helpAnswerToUserRequired.description: Boolean to determine if HelpAnswerToUser is required

helpAnswerToUser.description: Message text for mobile terminated message associated with HELP keyword e.g 'This is the HELP message test.'.

optOutAnswerToUserRequired.description: Boolean to determine if optOutAnswerToUser is required

optOutAnswerToUser.description: "Message text for mobile terminated message associated with STOP keyword e.g. 'This is the STOP message test.'.

optInMessageToUserRequired.description: Boolean to determine if optInMessage is required

hasEmbeddedLink.description: Indicates whether the message has an embedded link.

hasEmbeddedPhone.description: Indicates whether the message has an embedded phone number.

termsAndConditionsAccepted.description: Indicates whether the terms and conditions have been accepted.

hasAgeGatedContent.description: Indicates whether the message contains age-gated content.

hasDirectLending.description: Indicates whether the message involves direct lending.

TenDlcReviewNote.description: Holds a note about a 10DLC US Campaign that has gone thru stages of review process.

message.description: Note related to a Brand or Campaign that may imply changes needed from the client.

date.description: Date and time when the note was added to the Brand or Campaign.

TenDlcCost.description: The cost of a 10DLC Brand or Campaign

currencyCode.description: The ISO 4217 currency code for the cost amount, e.g. USD.

countryCode.description: The ISO 3166-2 code of the phone number's country, e.g. US.

billingFrequency.description: The frequency with which the cost gets billed.

TenDlcCosts.description: A wrapper for a list of 10DLC cost entities

nextLink.description: Represents the URL link to the next page of local 10DLC costs results.

TenDlcUSCampaignAttachment.description: A File Attachment for a 10DLC US Campaign

type.description: Attachment type describing the purpose of the attachment

fileName.description: The name of the file being attached. e.g. 'myFile01'

fileType.description: The type of file being attached e.g. 'pdf', 'jpg', 'png'

fileContentBase64.description: File content as base 64 encoded string

TenDlcUSCampaignAttachmentSummary.description: A summary of 10DLC US Campaign File Attachment data

type.description: Attachment type describing the purpose of the attachment e.g. 'callToAction', 'termsOfService'

fileName.description: The name of the attached file e.g. 'myFile01'

TenDlcUSCampaignAttachments.description: A wrapper for a list of 10DLC CampaignAttachment entities.

nextLink.description: Represents the URL link to the next page.

TenDlcUSBrand.description: Represents a US 10DLC brand with details and status information.

id.description: Unique identifier that corresponds to a brand

statusUpdatedDate.description: Last date and time when the 10DLC status was updated

costs.description: Represents the costs tied to the brand

submissionDate.description: Date and time when the 10DLC was submitted

reviewNotes.description: Notes added to the 10DLC Brand after being reviewed to help customer understand review results and necessary follow up actions.

id.description: Unique identifier that corresponds to a campaign

brandId.description: Unique identifier that corresponds to a brand

statusUpdatedDate.description: Last date and time when the 10DLC status was updated

costs.description: Represents the costs tied to the campaign

submissionDate.description: Date and time when the 10DLC was submitted

reviewNotes.description: Notes added to the 10DLC Campaign after being reviewed to help customer understand review results and necessary follow up actions.

phoneNumberCount.description: Count of local phone numbers currently associated to the 10DLC Campaign.

TenDlcUseCase.description: Compiles information describing the user case for a 10DLC messaging campaign.

sampleMessages.description: Sample messages that a user might send, as a proof of concept

TenDlcVettingDetails.description: Holds the details of the vetting process for a US 10DLC brand.

id.description: Gets or sets the ID of the vetting process.

score.description: Gets or sets the vetting score.

classification.description: Gets or sets the vetting class.

status.description: Gets or sets the vetting status.

errorReasons.description: Gets or sets the reasons for any errors that occurred during the vetting process.

TenDlcUSBrands.description: A wrapper for a list of 10DLC US Brands.

nextLink.description: Represents the URL link to the next page

TenDlcUSCampaigns.description: A wrapper for a list of 10DLC US Campaigns

nextLink.description: Represents the URL link to the next page

CountryCodeParameter.name: countryCode
CountryCodeParameter.description: The ISO 3166-2 country code, e.g. US.

MaxPageSizeParameter.name: maxPageSize
MaxPageSizeParameter.description: An optional parameter for how many entries to return, for pagination purposes. The default value is 100.

ReservationParameter.name: reservation
ReservationParameter.description: A representation of the desired state of the reservation.
